FuncDef:
The user-fqdn command configures a user-fully qualified domain name (USER-FQDN) for IKE peers that are allowed to access.
The undo user-fqdn command deletes the USER-FQDN for IKE peers that are allowed to access.
By default, no USER-FQDN is configured for IKE peers that are allowed to access.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a USER-FQDN of an entity.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters. The string does not contain question marks or spaces. The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo:
To describe an entity, run the user-fqdn command to configure a USER-FQDN for the entity.
A local device uses a USER-FQDN to filter IKE peers that attempt to access. If a USER-FQDN inconsistency occurs, IKE negotiation with the IKE peer fails.
